summary: This is a JPMorgan Chase asset account portfolio statement for the 'FINANCIAL TRUST COMPANY, INC.' for October 1999. It details significant cash movements, including a wire transfer of $18.3 million to Ghislaine Maxwell via Bear Stearns, and shows the account held over $6.7 million in a money market fund. It was entered as a government exhibit in a criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the beneficiary of an $18,300,000.00 wire transfer from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account to Bear Stearns.

persons.name: Scott
persons.context: Listed as an account officer or service specialist for the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at JPMorgan.

persons.name: Dencker
persons.context: Listed as an account officer or service specialist for the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at JPMorgan.

connections.description: A substantial wire transfer of $18.3 million was sent from the Financial Trust Company account to Bear Stearns, f/o (for the order of) Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are listed as account officers or service specialists for the same Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at JPMorgan.

events.title: Major Wire Transfer to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An $18,300,000 wire transfer was initiated from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account to Bear Stearns, for the order of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Large Deposit and Purchase
events.description: A $20,000,000 deposit was received and used to purchase shares in the J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund.

events.title: Additional Deposit and Purchase
events.description: A $5,000,000 deposit was received and used to purchase additional shares in the J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund.

locations: New York, NY 10154-1002 (Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York)
ST THOMAS US VIRGIN ISLDS 00802 (American Yacht Harbor, address for Financial Trust Company, Inc.)
keyFacts: A wire transfer of $18,300,000 was sent from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account to Bear Stearns 'FAO GHISLAINE MAXWELL' on October 19, 1999.
The Financial Trust Company, Inc. account held a portfolio value of over $6.7 million in a J.P. Morgan money market fund as of October 31, 1999.
The document is marked as 'GOVERNMENT EXHIBIT 505' and 'Confidential Treatment Requested by JPMorgan Chase', indicating its use in legal proceedings.
The account received $25 million in deposits in early October 1999 before the $18.3 million transfer to Maxwell later that month.
The trust was registered at an address in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, a known offshore financial center.
